name: Quetzalcoatl
title: The Feathered Serpent, God of Wind, Wisdom, and Life

about_section.title: The Creator of Humanity
about_section.description: Quetzalcoatl shaped the first humans from bones and gave them life, ensuring their prosperity through wisdom and knowledge.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: As the god of wind and knowledge, he brought civilization, writing, and the arts to humanity, guiding them towards enlightenment.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Quetzalcoatl was honored across Mesoamerica, particularly by the Toltecs and the Aztecs, as the benevolent god of civilization and wisdom.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: He opposed Tezcatlipoca, who tempted him into exile, and was later associated with cycles of renewal and transformation.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Serpent Form** represents his dual nature as a god of the heavens and the earth, while the **Codex of Knowledge** contains the wisdom he granted to humanity.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Legends say he departed the world on a raft of serpents, promising to return, a prophecy later associated with historical events.

legends: 🌪 The Birth of Humanity: Quetzalcoatl retrieved the bones of past generations and gave them life, shaping the first people.
🌀 The War Against Tezcatlipoca: A cosmic struggle between light and darkness, leading to his exile from Tula.
🔥 The Self-Sacrifice of Quetzalcoatl: In some versions, he immolated himself, rising as the Morning Star.
🌊 The Prophecy of His Return: A legend foretold his return, influencing historical narratives in Mesoamerica.
lore: 🌿 The Serpent Form: A divine representation of his role as both a celestial and earthly deity.
📖 The Codex of Knowledge: A sacred text containing the wisdom of the gods, gifted to humanity.
🌪 Wind of Creation: The breath of Quetzalcoatl is said to bring life, guide travelers, and stir the cosmos.

name: Huitzilopochtli
title: God of War, Sun, and Human Sacrifice

about_section.title: The Birth of the Warrior God
about_section.description: Born in full battle gear, Huitzilopochtli emerged from his mother Coatlicue to defeat his sister Coyolxauhqui and the 400 stars, securing his place as the sun god.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: He is the embodiment of war and the guiding force of the Aztecs, leading them to found Tenochtitlan through divine prophecy.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Huitzilopochtli was central to Aztec religious life, honored through grand ceremonies and human sacrifices at the Templo Mayor.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: His greatest rivalry was with his sister Coyolxauhqui and the stars, whom he vanquished in cosmic battle, ensuring the rise of the sun.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Fire Serpent (Xiuhcoatl)**, his weapon, symbolizes his destructive power, while the **Solar Disk** represents his celestial dominance.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: The Aztecs revered him as their divine patron, believing that their conquests and sacrifices sustained him in his eternal battle against the forces of darkness.

legends: ⚔ The Battle Against Coyolxauhqui: Huitzilopochtli struck down his sister, casting her broken body to the foot of Templo Mayor.
🔥 The Eternal War of the Sun: He fights daily against the forces of night, requiring blood sacrifice to ensure victory.
🛡 The Founding of Tenochtitlan: He guided the Mexica people to settle where they saw an eagle devouring a snake on a cactus.
☀ The Five Suns Myth: Huitzilopochtli is one of the divine beings who sustained the current era through cosmic struggle.
lore: 🗡 Xiuhcoatl (The Fire Serpent): A divine weapon representing the scorching force of the sun.
🌞 The Solar Disk: Symbol of his power as the warrior sun, demanding constant tribute to remain victorious.
🛡 The Shield of Tenochtitlan: A sacred artifact said to protect the Aztec capital from its enemies.

name: Tezcatlipoca
title: The Smoking Mirror, God of Sorcery and Fate

core_identity.faction: The Gods of Night and Destiny
core_identity.domain: Fate, Sorcery, Night, Deception, War, Chaos

about_section.title: The Lord of Fate and Chaos
about_section.description: Tezcatlipoca is a god of contradictions—both a bringer of fortune and destruction, guiding destinies while shrouding them in uncertainty.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: He wields the Smoking Mirror, an obsidian portal that reveals truths and illusions, and is known for manipulating mortals and gods alike.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: As a god of rulers and warriors, Tezcatlipoca was honored with human sacrifices and revered for his role in shaping fate.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: His greatest rivalry is with Quetzalcoatl, whom he tricked into exile, yet he also stands as a cosmic force necessary for balance.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: His **Smoking Mirror** grants visions of truth and deception, while his **Jaguar Form** embodies his power over war and the night.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Tezcatlipoca is said to walk among mortals in disguise, testing their virtues and dooming those who succumb to their desires.

legends: 🌀 The Exile of Quetzalcoatl: Tezcatlipoca deceived Quetzalcoatl, causing his downfall and departure from Tula.
🐆 The Jaguar Sun: He ruled the first world as the Jaguar Sun, until Quetzalcoatl destroyed it in their eternal struggle.
🔥 The Test of Kings: Aztec rulers were chosen by a ritual dedicated to Tezcatlipoca, proving their worth through trials of fate.
🌑 The Mirror of Truth: Those who gazed into his Smoking Mirror saw either their destiny or their doom.
lore: 🪞 The Smoking Mirror: A sacred obsidian mirror through which Tezcatlipoca reveals hidden truths and illusions.
🐆 The Jaguar Form: He transforms into a jaguar, symbolizing his connection to warriors and the night.
⚔ The Obsidian Blade: A weapon forged from darkness, said to cut through both flesh and fate.

name: Tlaloc
title: The Rain God and Lord of Storms

about_section.title: The Bringer of Rain and Life
about_section.description: Tlaloc controls the rain and water cycles, ensuring the prosperity of crops and the survival of civilizations.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: With his divine waters, he nourishes the land, but he can also unleash devastating floods and storms upon those who displease him.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Highly revered by farmers, Tlaloc was honored with rituals and sacrifices to ensure seasonal rains and agricultural bounty.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: His allies include Quetzalcoatl and Chalchiuhtlicue, while he opposes droughts and the destructive forces of fire gods.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Sacred Jar** contains the life-giving rains, while his **Lightning** strikes down those who defy the will of nature.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Tlaloc was both feared and worshiped, with children sacrificed in his name to ensure abundant rains and prevent devastating droughts.

legends: 💦 The Tears of the Children: It was believed that the tears of sacrificed children pleased Tlaloc and brought rainfall.
⛈ The Flood of Renewal: In some myths, Tlaloc unleashed a great flood to cleanse the world and restore balance.
🌾 The Guardian of Crops: Farmers prayed to Tlaloc, leaving offerings to secure his blessings for a bountiful harvest.
🌊 The Waters of Paradise: Tlaloc rules over **Tlalocan**, a lush afterlife reserved for those who died by water-related causes.
lore: ⚡ Thunderous Lightning: Tlaloc wields lightning bolts to command the skies and bring storms.
💦 The Sacred Jar: A mystical vessel holding the waters that nourish or punish the earth.
🌊 The Rains of Life: The life-giving waters that sustain civilization and agriculture.

name: Xipe Totec
title: The Flayed God, Lord of Rebirth and Renewal

core_identity.faction: The Gods of Life and Death

about_section.title: The God of Rebirth and Renewal
about_section.description: Xipe Totec represents the cycle of life and death, shedding his old skin to bring forth new growth and prosperity.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: As the deity of agricultural fertility, he symbolizes the renewal of crops and the transformation of life through sacrifice.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: He was honored in **Tlacaxipehualiztli**, the ‘Flaying of Men’ festival, where warriors were sacrificed, and their skin worn to symbolize renewal.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Xipe Totec works alongside Tlaloc to ensure seasonal renewal but opposes stagnation and forces that hinder transformation.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: His **Flayed Skin** represents the shedding of the old to bring forth new life, while the **Sacred Maize** is his gift of sustenance.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: He is invoked by warriors, farmers, and those seeking renewal, with sacrifices made in his honor to bring about transformation and abundance.

legends: 🩸 The Festival of Flayed Men: Priests donned the flayed skins of sacrificial victims, symbolizing rebirth and renewal.
🌽 The Gift of Maize: Xipe Totec ensured the growth of crops by ‘shedding’ his skin, mirroring the husking of corn.
⚔ The Warrior’s Transformation: Those who died in ritual combat were offered to him, their bodies fueling the cycle of life.
🔥 The Trial of Renewal: Through sacrifice, the Aztecs believed he cleansed the world and restored balance.
lore: 🩸 The Flayed Skin: A symbol of transformation and the shedding of the past for new life.
🌽 The Sacred Maize: Represents Xipe Totec’s power over agriculture and sustenance.
⚔ The Ritual Knife: The tool of sacrifice used in ceremonies dedicated to him.
